clear().Description: Removes all of the elements from this list. The list will be empty after this call returns.

Returns: the element previously at the specified position
Parameters: int: index of the element to replace
T: element to be stored at the specified position
set(int, T).Description: Replaces the element at the specified position in this list with the specified element.

Returns: true if this list changed as a result of the call
Parameters: int: index at which to insert the first element from the specified collection
Collection: collection containing elements to be added to this list
addAll(int, java.util.Collection<? exten.Description: Inserts all of the elements in the specified collection into this list, starting at the specified position. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (increases their indices). The new elements will appear in the list in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator.
addAll(int, java.util.Collection<? exten.FullName: boolean addAll (int index, Collection<? extends T> collection)

Parameters: int: index at which the specified element is to be inserted
add(int, T).Description: Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this list. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (adds one to their indices).

Parameters: int: index of first element to be removed
int: index after last element to be removed
removeRange(int, int).Description: Removes from this list all of the elements whose index is between fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive. Shifts any succeeding elements to the left (reduces their index). This call shortens the list by (toIndex - fromIndex) elements. (If toIndex==fromIndex, this operation has no effect.)

Returns: true if this list changed as a result of the call
Parameters: Collection: collection containing elements to be added to this list
addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends T>.Description: Appends all of the elements in the specified collection to the end of this list, in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's Iterator. The behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress. (This implies that the behavior of this call is undefined if the specified collection is this list, and this list is nonempty.)

Returns: true if this list contained the specified element
Parameters: Object: element to be removed from this list, if present
remove(java.lang.Object).Description: Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from this list, if it is present. If the list does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index

Parameters: T: element to be appended to this list
add(T).Description: Appends the specified element to the end of this list.

Returns: the element that was removed from the list
Parameters: int: the index of the element to be removed
remove(int).Description: Removes the element at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices).

ClassDesc: An @B_android#databinding#ObservableList_E@ implementation using ArrayList as an implementation.
